moves.1. Nf3 Nf6 2. c4 e6 3. b3 Bb4 4. g3: I was following the basic line structure that I saw played over a few matches. I was not too worried about what Black was doing as there was no imminent threat.
moves.4... c5 5. Bg2 Nc6 6. O-O O-O 7. Bb2 Re8: Maybe I should have played e3 before I played d4.
moves.8... cxd4 9. Nxd4 e5 10. Nxc6 bxc6 11. a: In retrospect, I probably did not need to chase the N and I did not think ahead to where it would move next leaving me with a forked B/R.
moves.18. Rc1 dxc4 19. Nxc4 Nxg2 20. Kxg2 c5+: Looking back, I was not looking for the Q to move which was an oversight on my part. If I had followed proper thought processes I would have caught that and played differently.
moves.22. Bxe5 Qg2+ 23. Ke1 Qxg3+ 24. Kd2: Post match analysis indicates that I should have played Kd1 vice Kd2.
moves.24... Rbd8+ 25. Kc2: As my K was marshalled towards the edge I could tell that I should have structured the defense differently. Some of the strongest defensive pieces were left helpless and trapped in the corner.
